intro: Moenchia podolicum, commonly known as the common bedstraw, is a flowering plant in the Rosaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features slender, ascending stems with opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, white or pink, and arranged in dense, terminal clusters. Moenchia podolicum is often found in disturbed soils and is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of habitats.
